q: Do Fort Myers homes still need flood panels after levee improvements?
a: Yes—urban drainage and Caloosahatchee backflow still cause ground-floor flooding during King Tides. Panels protect doors and garages from localized ponding.

q: Which panels are recommended for Fort Myers brick homes?
a: Use compression-mounted aluminum frames with mechanical anchors into mortar joints rated ≥ 2,000 psi. See anchor-bolt requirements.

q: Can flood panels be reused after a major storm?
a: Yes—if frames remain square and gaskets intact. Have technicians test for seal compression per FEMA TB-3 Appendix C after event.

q: Does Lee County offer rebates for flood proofing?
a: Some community mitigation programs cover up to $2,500 for certified barrier installs. We supply required documentation.

q: Where can I see local examples?
a: Visit our Fort Myers demo property showing garage and doorway systems.
